DataElement.preferredName: Unknown Bone Marrow Source Plasma Cell Present Finding Status Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to the status of the laboratory results for plasma cells in an unknown bone marrow source.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Unknown Bone Marrow Source Plasma Cell Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused._The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes._Where something is available or from where it originates._Specialized forms of antibody-producing B-LYMPHOCYTES. They synthesize and secrete immunoglobulin. They are found only in lymphoid organs and at sites of immune responses and normally do not circulate in the blood or lymph. (Rosen et al., Dictionary of Immunology, 1989, p169 & Abbas et al., Cellular and Molecular Immunology, 2d ed, p20)_Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

They synthesize and secrete immunoglobulin. They are found only in lymphoid organs and at sites of immune responses and normally do not circulate in the blood or lymph. (Rosen et al., Dictionary of Immunology, 1989, p169 & Abbas et al., Cellular and Molecular Immunology, 2d ed, p20)

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.
The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.
Where something is available or from where it originates.
A fully mature B-Cell that produces a specific antibody.
